post: Do you know a Texas student who is making a difference in their community through an act of service? Encourage them to participate in our Texas MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair sponsored by Travelers. Find out more on our event page!  https://bit.ly/4ffW2hX Open to Texas-based young people 13-19 years old.

Thank you to Periodic Presidents for supporting BRIs Civics for Everyone initiative! Their visual infographics make U. S. presidents and civic ideas more accessible for all learners, especially reluctant readers. Learn how you can support our initiative today: bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #EducationForAll  #HistoryTeachers  #VisualLearning

#TDIH in 1821, Missouri entered the Union as the 24th state, sparking fierce debates over slavery and statehood. What can we learn from this moment about federalism? This essay from our U. S. History curriculum provides a helpful starting place:  https://bit.ly/45uSZz4  #TDiH  #BRI250  #AmericanHistory  #Civics  #Federalism

A well-made flag makes a statement about your values, your community, and your country. Federal Flags, LLC offers American-made flags and flagpoles for homes, schools, and civic spaces. Use code BRI5 to save while supporting our civic education mission. 🛒  https://bit.ly/3z2vhMW  #FederalFlags  #CivicEducation  #MadeInUSA  #SupportTeachers

How do you teach civic responsibility through real service? Retired Col. Michael Komorous talks with our own Gerald Gangaram about his career in the Air Force, his time working in legislative affairs at the Pentagon, and his desire to continue to highlight veterans' stories on his podcast, Voice for Valor. 🎥 Watch:  https://bit.ly/4msQS4N  #CivicVirtue  #LeadershipDevelopment  #VeteranVoices  #MentorshipMatters

#OTD 1965, the Voting Rights Act was signed into law, protecting Black citizens from racial discrimination at the ballot box. 🗳 Why does voting access still matter? Check out our primary source activity to start this discussion with your students:  https://bit.ly/43KjD31  #VotingRights  #CivicEducation  #BRI250  #TDiH

Every $1 helps an educator share the Constitution with a student. How will you champion civics this school year? $1 = 1 copy:  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicEducation  #EducationMatters  #Philanthropy  #Constitution

Were grateful to Huddle Up for their support of our Civics for Everyone initiative. Their work helps ensure all students can engage as informed citizens. Learn how you can support our initiative today: bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #SpecialEducation  #StudentSupport  #EdEquity

What was it like for George Washington to show courage? What does it mean for you to show courage?  In this back-to-school conversation, Joe Schmidt shares how the Bill of Rights Institute equips teachers to connect current events to constitutional principles and civic virtues, without partisanship. From classroom-ready support during the school year to real-time help with big, timely questions like Why is this in the news? , BRI is meeting educators where they are. 🎥 Watch the full conversation:  https://bit.ly/4fbJZCi  #CivicEducation  #EducationLeadership  #BackToSchool  #SocialStudies

Do you know a Florida student who is making a difference in their community through an act of service? Encourage them to participate in our Florida MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair sponsored by Travelers. Find out more on our event page:  https://bit.ly/4lOOwgs Open to Florida-based young people 13-19 years old.
